result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelai Sherri Mathews

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angelai Sherri Mathews in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Angelai Sherri Mathews.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 10/27/2022. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Angelai Sherri Mathews in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel recently appointed and has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALM, AME, OAM, NMM. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Angelai Sherri Mathews in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 2:30p
